page.title: 08Carlisle Great Fair (ii)
page.content: The "Cumberland News" for 30/8/85 reported that the{Sands Centre (see {pp.2-3)}stood to lose several thous- and pounds on their Little and Large and Lenny Henry shows, perhaps because there were too many other events in the City. These included: a Ray Cooney farce at the 50 seat Green Room Theatre on West Walls; the Victorians' Palace of Varieties in the City Hall; the Donald Scott revue at the Stanwix Arts Theatre (Art College); recitals in the Cathedral and the Crown and Mitre Hotel; and a Jacobite supper with fiddle music and 18th century dishes in the Tithe Barn. Cancelled because Bitts Park is water- logged as a result of the wet summer, the usual Fun Fair...and a projected City Centre cycle race through lack of entries.The annual Flower Show managed 1000 entries despite the weather!
